role.label: Accounts receivable, net
role.documentation: Amount, after allowance, receivable from customers, clients, or other third-parties, and receivables classified as other due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Accounts payable
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

role.label: Accrued expenses and other liabilities
role.documentation: Amount of expenses incurred but not yet paid nor invoiced, and liabilities classified as other.

role.label: Accrued expenses
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities.

role.label: Sales tax liability
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable for statutory payroll taxes incurred through that date and withheld from employees pertaining to services received from them, including entity's matching share of the employees FICA taxes and contributions to the state and federal unemployment insurance programs. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

role.label: Payroll related liabilities
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of the obligations incurred through that date and payable for employees' services provided. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

role.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss) [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

role.label: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income (Loss) [Table]
role.documentation: Disclosure of information about components of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss).

role.label: AOCI Attributable to Parent [Member]
role.documentation: Accumulated increase (decrease) in equity from transactions and other events and circumstances from non-owner sources, attributable to the parent. Excludes net income (loss), and accumulated changes in equity from transactions resulting from investments by owners and distributions to owners.

role.label: Acquired assets estimated useful lives
role.documentation: Weighted average amortization period of finite-lived intangible assets acquired either individually or as part of a group of assets, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents the reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days.

role.label: Additional paid-in capital
role.documentation: Amount of excess of issue price over par or stated value of stock and from other transaction involving stock or stockholder. Includes, but is not limited to, additional paid-in capital (APIC) for common and preferred stock.

role.label: Additional Paid-in Capital [Member]
role.documentation: Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving the entity's stock or stockholders.

role.label: Adjustment to Non-PEO NEO Compensation Footnote
Stock-based compensation
role.documentation: Amount of increase to additional paid-in capital (APIC) for recognition of cost for award under share-based payment arrangement.

role.label: Value of additional stock issued
role.documentation: Adjustments to additional paid in capital stock issued issuance cost

role.label: Issuance of pre-funded warrants in connection with services contract
role.documentation: Amount of increase in additional paid in capital (APIC) resulting from the issuance of warrants. Includes allocation of proceeds of debt securities issued with detachable stock purchase warrants.

role.label: Adjustments to reconcile net loss to net cash used in operating activities:

role.documentation: The amount of advances from related parties.
role.label: AdvancesWithRelatedPartiesCurrent
Advisory Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Advisory Agreement [Member]

role.label: Aggregate Erroneous Compensation Not Yet Determined
Alabama Exclusive Private Label Manufacturing Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Alabama Exclusive Private Label Manufacturing Agreement [Member]

role.label: Stock-based compensation expense
role.documentation: Amount of expense for award under share-based payment arrangement. Excludes amount capitalized.

role.label: Allowance for credit loss
role.documentation: Amount of allowance for credit loss on accounts receivable.

role.label: Amendment Description
role.documentation: Description of changes contained within amended document.

role.label: Amendment Flag
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the XBRL content amends previously-filed or accepted submission.

role.label: Amortization of loan discount and fees
role.documentation: Amount of amortization expense attributable to debt discount (premium) and debt issuance costs.

role.label: Amortization expense
role.documentation: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets.

role.label: Annual Information Form
role.documentation: Boolean flag with value true on a form if it is an annual report containing an annual information form.

role.label: Total potentially dilutive shares
role.documentation: Securities (including those issuable pursuant to contingent stock agreements) that could potentially dilute basic earnings per share (EPS) or earnings per unit (EPU) in the future that were not included in the computation of diluted EPS or EPU because to do so would increase EPS or EPU amounts or decrease loss per share or unit amounts for the period presented.

role.label: Antidilutive Securities [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type of antidilutive security.

role.label: Antidilutive Securities Excluded from Computation of Earnings Per Share [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

Incremental common shares attributable to securities that were not included in diluted earnings per share (EPS) because to do so would increase EPS amounts or decrease loss per share amounts for the period presented.

role.label: Area of Land
role.documentation: Area of land held.
Collaborative arrangement and arrangement other than collaborative applicable to revenue-generating activity or operations.

role.label: Asset Purchase Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Asset Purchase Agreement [Member]

role.label: Assets
role.documentation: Amount of asset recognized for present right to economic benefit.

role.label: Assets, Current
role.documentation: Amount of asset recognized for present right to economic benefit, classified as current.

role.label: Audited Annual Financial Statements
role.documentation: Boolean flag with value true on a form if it is an annual report containing audited financial statements.

role.label: Fair Value as of Grant Date
Award Type [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type of award under share-based payment arrangement.

role.label: Awards Close in Time to MNPI Disclosures, Individual Name
Awards Close in Time to MNPI Disclosures [Table]
Awards Close in Time to MNPI Disclosures, Table
Bailey 44 LLC [Member]
role.documentation: Bailey 44 LLC [Member]

role.label: Basis of Presentation
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for basis of accounting, or basis of presentation, used to prepare the financial statements (for example, US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Other Comprehensive Basis of Accounting, IFRS).

role.label: [custom:BeneficialOwnershipOfOutstandingSharesPercent-0]
role.documentation: Beneficial ownership of outstanding shares percent
Business combination or series of individually immaterial business combinations.

role.label: Business Combination [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by business combination or series of individually immaterial business combinations.

role.label: Percentage of equity acquired
role.documentation: Percentage of voting equity interest acquired in business combination.

role.label: Business Combinations
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for business combination.

role.label: Cash
role.documentation: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

role.label: Cash and cash equivalents
role.documentation: Amount of cash and cash equivalent. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposit with financial institution, and account with general characteristic of demand deposit. Cash equivalent includes, but is not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investment that is both readily convertible to known amount of cash and so near maturity that it presents insignificant risk of change in value because of change in interest rate.

role.label: Cash and Equivalents and Concentration of Credit Risk
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for cash and cash equivalents, including the policy for determining which items are treated as cash equivalents. Other information that may be disclosed includes (1) the nature of any restrictions on the entity's use of its cash and cash equivalents, (2) whether the entity's cash and cash equivalents are insured or expose the entity to credit risk, (3) the classification of any negative balance accounts (overdrafts), and (4) the carrying basis of cash equivalents (for example, at cost) and whether the carrying amount of cash equivalents approximates fair value.

role.periodStartLabel: Cash and cash equivalents at beginning of period
role.periodEndLabel: Cash and cash equivalents at end of period
role.label: Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Including Discontinued Operation
role.documentation: Amount of cash and cash equivalent, and cash and cash equivalent restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, discontinued operation. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposit with financial institution, and account with general characteristic of demand deposit. Cash equivalent includes, but is not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investment that is both readily convertible to known amount of cash and so near maturity that it presents insignificant risk of change in value because of change in interest rate.

role.totalLabel: Net change in cash and cash equivalents
role.label: Cash, Cash Equivalent, Restricted Cash, and Restricted Cash Equivalent, Period Increase (Decrease), Excluding Exchange Rate Effect, Including Discontinued Operation
role.documentation: Amount, excluding effect from change in exchange rate, of increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalent, and cash and cash equivalent restricted to withdrawal or usage; including, but not limited to, discontinued operation. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposit with financial institution, and account with general characteristic of demand deposit. Cash equivalent includes, but is not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investment that is both readily convertible to known amount of cash and so near maturity that it presents insignificant risk of change in value because of change in interest rate.

role.label: Cash Equivalents, at Carrying Value
role.documentation: Amount of short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.

role.label: FDIC insured limit
role.documentation: The amount of cash deposited in financial institutions as of the balance sheet date that is insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

role.label: [custom:CashFeeDividedValue-0]
role.documentation: Cash fee divided value.
Change in credit reserve.
role.label: ChangeInCreditReserve
City Area Code
role.documentation: Area code of city

Share of stock differentiated by the voting rights the holder receives. Examples include, but are not limited to, common stock, redeemable preferred stock, nonredeemable preferred stock, and convertible stock.

role.label: Class of Warrant or Right, Exercise Price of Warrants or Rights
role.documentation: Exercise price per share or per unit of warrants or rights outstanding.

role.label: Pre-funded warrants to purchase common stock
role.verboseLabel: Class of Warrant or Right, Number of Securities Called by Each Warrant or Right
role.documentation: Number of securities into which each warrant or right may be converted. For example, but not limited to, each warrant may be converted into two shares.

role.label: Class of Warrant or Right, Number of Securities Called by Warrants or Rights
role.documentation: Number of securities into which the class of warrant or right may be converted. For example, but not limited to, 500,000 warrants may be converted into 1,000,000 shares.

role.label: Warrants to purchase shares of common stock
role.verboseLabel: Class of Warrant or Right, Outstanding
role.documentation: Number of warrants or rights outstanding.

role.label: Collaborative Arrangement and Arrangement Other than Collaborative [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

role.label: Commitments and contingencies
role.documentation: Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.

role.label: CONTINGENCIES
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for commitments and contingencies.

role.label: Common Stock [Member]
role.documentation: Stock that is subordinate to all other stock of the issuer.

role.label: Common stock, par value
role.verboseLabel: Common Stock, Par or Stated Value Per Share
role.documentation: Face amount or stated value per share of common stock.

role.label: Common stock, share authorized
role.documentation: The maximum number of common shares permitted to be issued by an entity's charter and bylaws.

role.label: Common stock, share issued
role.documentation: Total number of common shares of an entity that have been sold or granted to shareholders (includes common shares that were issued, repurchased and remain in the treasury). These shares represent capital invested by the firm's shareholders and owners, and may be all or only a portion of the number of shares authorized. Shares issued include shares outstanding and shares held in the treasury.

role.label: Common stock, shares outstanding
role.documentation: Number of shares of common stock outstanding. Common stock represent the ownership interest in a corporation.

role.label: Common stock, $0.0001 par value per share; 1,000,000,000 shares authorized, 4,491,321 and 838,584 shares issued and outstanding as of June 30, 2025 and December 31, 2024, respectively
role.verboseLabel: Common stock, $0.0001 par value per share, 1,000,000,000 shares authorized, 4,491,321 and 838,584 shares issued and outstanding as of June 30, 2025 and December 31, 2024, respectively
role.documentation: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

role.label: Voting rights
role.documentation: Description of voting rights of common stock. Includes eligibility to vote and votes per share owned. Include also, if any, unusual voting rights.

role.label: Compensation Actually Paid vs. Company Selected Measure
Compensation Actually Paid vs. Net Income
Compensation Actually Paid vs. Other Measure
Compensation Actually Paid vs. Total Shareholder Return
Company Warehouse and Distribution Center [Member]
role.documentation: Company Warehouse and Distribution Center [Member]

role.label: Stock-Based Compensation
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for salaries, bonuses, incentive awards, postretirement and postemployment benefits granted to employees, including equity-based arrangements; discloses methodologies for measurement, and the bases for recognizing related assets and liabilities and recognizing and reporting compensation expense.

role.label: Principles of Consolidation
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy regarding (1) the principles it follows in consolidating or combining the separate financial statements, including the principles followed in determining the inclusion or exclusion of subsidiaries or other entities in the consolidated or combined financial statements and (2) its treatment of interests (for example, common stock, a partnership interest or other means of exerting influence) in other entities, for example consolidation or use of the equity or cost methods of accounting. The accounting policy may also address the accounting treatment for intercompany accounts and transactions, noncontrolling interest, and the income statement treatment in consolidation for issuances of stock by a subsidiary.

role.verboseLabel: Conversion of preferred shares into common stock
role.documentation: Conversion of preferred shares into common stock.
role.label: ConversionOfPreferredSharesIntoCommonStock
Conversion of stock, shares converted
role.documentation: The number of shares converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

role.label: Conversion of stock, shares issued
role.documentation: The number of new shares issued in the conversion of stock in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. Noncash is defined as transactions during a period that do not result in cash receipts or cash payments in the period. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or cash payments in the period.

role.label: Convertible debt
role.documentation: Including the current and noncurrent portions, carrying amount of debt identified as being convertible into another form of financial instrument (typically the entity's common stock) as of the balance sheet date, which originally required full repayment more than twelve months after issuance or greater than the normal operating cycle of the company.

role.label: Convertible note payable, net
role.documentation: The portion of the carrying value of long-term convertible debt as of the balance sheet date that is scheduled to be repaid within one year or in the normal operating cycle if longer. Convertible debt is a financial instrument which can be exchanged for a specified amount of another security, typically the entity's common stock, at the option of the issuer or the holder.

role.label: Convertible Debt Securities [Member]
role.documentation: Debt securities that can be exchanged for equity of the debt issuer at the option of the issuer or the holder.

role.label: Convertible Instruments
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for determining the convertible instruments.

role.label: Convertible preferred stock value
role.documentation: Value of convertible preferred stock that was converted to other securities.

role.label: Cost of net revenues
role.documentation: The aggregate cost of goods produced and sold and services rendered during the reporting period.

role.label: Cost of Revenues
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for cost of product sold and service rendered.

role.label: Country Region
role.documentation: Region code of country

role.label: Cover [Abstract]
role.documentation: Cover page.

role.label: Current and Former Executives and Board [Member]
role.documentation: Current and Former Executives and Board [Member]

role.label: Current Fiscal Year End Date
role.documentation: End date of current fiscal year in the format --MM-DD.

role.label: Customer Relationships [Member]
role.documentation: Customer relationship that exists between an entity and its customer, for example, but not limited to, tenant relationships.

role.label: Number of shares resulting from conversion
role.documentation: The number of shares issued in exchange for the original debt being converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or payments in the period.

role.label: LIABILITIES AND DEBT
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for information about short-term and long-term debt arrangements, which includes amounts of borrowings under each line of credit, note payable, commercial paper issue, bonds indenture, debenture issue, own-share lending arrangements and any other contractual agreement to repay funds, and about the underlying arrangements, rationale for a classification as long-term, including repayment terms, interest rates, collateral provided, restrictions on use of assets and activities, whether or not in compliance with debt covenants, and other matters important to users of the financial statements, such as the effects of refinancing and noncompliance with debt covenants.

role.label: Debt Instrument [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type of debt instrument, including, but not limited to, draws against credit facilities.

role.label: Debt instrument variable rate
role.documentation: Percentage points added to the reference rate to compute the variable rate on the debt instrument.

role.label: Principal
role.documentation: Amount, before unamortized (discount) premium and debt issuance costs, of long-term debt. Includes, but is not limited to, notes payable, bonds payable, commercial loans, mortgage loans, convertible debt, subordinated debt and other types of debt.

role.label: Debt Instrument, Decrease, Forgiveness
role.documentation: Decrease for amounts of indebtedness forgiven by the holder of the debt instrument.

role.label: Purchase price
role.documentation: Face (par) amount of debt instrument at time of issuance.

role.label: Interest rate
role.documentation: Contractual interest rate for funds borrowed, under the debt agreement.

role.label: Debt Instrument [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

role.label: Maturity date
role.documentation: Date when the debt instrument is scheduled to be fully repaid, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

role.label: Maturity date description
role.documentation: Description of the maturity date of the debt instrument including whether the debt matures serially and, if so, a brief description of the serial maturities.
The name for the particular debt instrument or borrowing that distinguishes it from other debt instruments or borrowings, including draws against credit facilities.

role.label: Monthly payments
role.documentation: Amount of the required periodic payments including both interest and principal payments.

role.label: Schedule of Long-Term Debt Instruments [Table]
role.documentation: Disclosure of information about long-term debt instrument or arrangement.

role.label: Debt discount
role.documentation: Amount, after accumulated amortization, of debt discount.

role.label: Deferred Costs, Capitalized, Prepaid, and Other Assets Disclosure [Abstract]
Deferred tax liability
role.documentation: Amount, after deferred tax asset, of deferred tax liability attributable to taxable differences with jurisdictional netting.

role.label: Deposits
role.documentation: The carrying amount of the asset transferred to a third party to serve as a deposit, which typically serves as security against failure by the transferor to perform under terms of an agreement.

role.label: Depreciation and amortization charges
role.documentation: The current period expense charged against earnings on long-lived, physical assets not used in production, and which are not intended for resale, to allocate or recognize the cost of such assets over their useful lives; or to record the reduction in book value of an intangible asset over the benefit period of such asset; or to reflect consumption during the period of an asset that is not used in production.

role.label: Depreciation and amortization
role.documentation: The aggregate expense recognized in the current period that allocates the cost of tangible assets, intangible assets, or depleting assets to periods that benefit from use of the assets.

role.label: Common Stock Purchase Warrants and Other Derivative Financial Instruments
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for its derivative instruments and hedging activities.

role.label: SHARE-BASED PAYMENTS
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for share-based payment arrangement.

role.label: Distribution
role.documentation: Distribution expenses.

role.label: Document Accounting Standard
role.documentation: The basis of accounting the registrant has used to prepare the financial statements included in this filing This can either be 'U.S. GAAP', 'International Financial Reporting Standards', or 'Other'.

role.label: Document Annual Report
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true only for a form used as an annual report.

role.label: Document Fiscal Period Focus
role.documentation: Fiscal period values are FY, Q1, Q2, and Q3. 1st, 2nd and 3rd quarter 10-Q or 10-QT statements have value Q1, Q2, and Q3 respectively, with 10-K, 10-KT or other fiscal year statements having FY.

role.label: Document Fiscal Year Focus
role.documentation: This is focus fiscal year of the document report in YYYY format. For a 2006 annual report, which may also provide financial information from prior periods, fiscal 2006 should be given as the fiscal year focus. Example: 2006.

role.label: Document Period End Date
role.documentation: For the EDGAR submission types of Form 8-K: the date of the report, the date of the earliest event reported; for the EDGAR submission types of Form N-1A: the filing date; for all other submission types: the end of the reporting or transition period. The format of the date is YYYY-MM-DD.

role.label: Document Period Start Date
role.documentation: The start date of the period covered in the document, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

role.label: Document Quarterly Report
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true only for a form used as an quarterly report.

role.label: Document Registration Statement
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true only for a form used as a registration statement.

role.label: Document Shell Company Event Date
role.documentation: Date of event requiring a shell company report.

role.label: Document Shell Company Report
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true for a Shell Company Report pursuant to section 13 or 15(d) of the Exchange Act.

role.label: Document Transition Report
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true only for a form used as a transition report.

role.label: Document Type
role.documentation: The type of document being provided (such as 10-K, 10-Q, 485BPOS, etc). The document type is limited to the same value as the supporting SEC submission type, or the word 'Other'.

role.label: Documents Incorporated by Reference [Text Block]
role.documentation: Documents incorporated by reference.
Due to related parties.
role.label: DueToRelatedParties
Net loss per common share - basic
role.documentation: The amount of net income (loss) for the period per each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.

role.label: Net loss per common share - diluted
role.documentation: The amount of net income (loss) for the period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.

role.label: Net Loss per Share
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for computing basic and diluted earnings or loss per share for each class of common stock and participating security. Addresses all significant policy factors, including any antidilutive items that have been excluded from the computation and takes into account stock dividends, splits and reverse splits that occur after the balance sheet date of the latest reporting period but before the issuance of the financial statements.

role.label: Share-Based Payment Arrangement, Option [Member]
role.documentation: Share-based payment arrangement granting right, subject to vesting and other restrictions, to purchase or sell certain number of shares at predetermined price for specified period of time.

role.label: Entity Address, Address Line One
role.documentation: Address Line 1 such as Attn, Building Name, Street Name

role.label: Entity Address, Address Line Two
role.documentation: Address Line 2 such as Street or Suite number

role.label: Entity Address, Address Line Three
role.documentation: Address Line 3 such as an Office Park

role.label: Entity Address, City or Town
role.documentation: Name of the City or Town

role.label: Entity Address, Country
role.documentation: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

role.label: Entity Address, Postal Zip Code
role.documentation: Code for the postal or zip code

role.label: Entity Address, State or Province
role.documentation: Name of the state or province.

role.label: Entity Bankruptcy Proceedings, Reporting Current
role.documentation: For registrants involved in bankruptcy proceedings during the preceding five years, the value Yes indicates that the registrant has filed all documents and reports required to be filed by Section 12, 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 subsequent to the distribution of securities under a plan confirmed by a court; the value No indicates the registrant has not. Registrants not involved in bankruptcy proceedings during the preceding five years should not report this element.

role.label: Entity Central Index Key
role.documentation: A unique 10-digit SEC-issued value to identify entities that have filed disclosures with the SEC. It is commonly abbreviated as CIK.

role.label: Entity Common Stock, Shares Outstanding
role.documentation: Indicate number of shares or other units outstanding of each of registrant's classes of capital or common stock or other ownership interests, if and as stated on cover of related periodic report. Where multiple classes or units exist define each class/interest by adding class of stock items such as Common Class A [Member], Common Class B [Member] or Partnership Interest [Member] onto the Instrument [Domain] of the Entity Listings, Instrument.

role.label: Entity Current Reporting Status
role.documentation: Indicate 'Yes' or 'No' whether registrants (1) have filed all reports required to be filed by Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that registrants were required to file such reports), and (2) have been subject to such filing requirements for the past 90 days. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.

All the names of the entities being reported upon in a document. Any legal structure used to conduct activities or to hold assets. Some examples of such structures are corporations, partnerships, limited liability companies, grantor trusts, and other trusts. This item does not include business and geographical segments which are included in the geographical or business segments domains.

role.label: Entity Emerging Growth Company
role.documentation: Indicate if registrant meets the emerging growth company criteria.

role.label: Elected Not To Use the Extended Transition Period
role.documentation: Indicate if an emerging growth company has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards.

role.label: Entity File Number
role.documentation: Commission file number. The field allows up to 17 characters. The prefix may contain 1-3 digits, the sequence number may contain 1-8 digits, the optional suffix may contain 1-4 characters, and the fields are separated with a hyphen.

role.label: Entity Filer Category
role.documentation: Indicate whether the registrant is one of the following: Large Accelerated Filer, Accelerated Filer, Non-accelerated Filer. Definitions of these categories are stated in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.

role.label: Entity Incorporation, State or Country Code
role.documentation: Two-character EDGAR code representing the state or country of incorporation.

role.label: Entity Interactive Data Current
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the registrant has submitted electronically every Interactive Data File required to be submitted pursuant to Rule 405 of Regulation S-T during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was required to submit such files).

role.label: Entity Listing, Par Value Per Share
role.documentation: The par value per share of security quoted in same currency as Trading currency. Example: '0.01'.

role.label: Entity Primary SIC Number
role.documentation: Primary Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Number for the Entity.

role.label: Entity Public Float
role.documentation: The aggregate market value of the voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates computed by reference to the price at which the common equity was last sold, or the average bid and asked price of such common equity, as of the last business day of the registrant's most recently completed second fiscal quarter.

role.label: Entity Registrant Name
role.documentation: The exact name of the entity filing the report as specified in its charter, which is required by forms filed with the SEC.

role.label: Entity Shell Company
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the registrant is a shell company as defined in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act.

role.label: Entity Small Business
role.documentation: Indicates that the company is a Smaller Reporting Company (SRC).

role.label: Entity Tax Identification Number
role.documentation: The Tax Identification Number (TIN), also known as an Employer Identification Number (EIN), is a unique 9-digit value assigned by the IRS.

role.label: Entity Voluntary Filers
role.documentation: Indicate 'Yes' or 'No' if the registrant is not required to file reports pursuant to Section 13 or Section 15(d) of the Act.

role.label: Entity Well-known Seasoned Issuer
role.documentation: Indicate 'Yes' or 'No' if the registrant is a well-known seasoned issuer, as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act. Is used on Form Type: 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K, 20-F, 6-K, 10-K/A, 10-Q/A, 20-F/A, 6-K/A, N-CSR, N-Q, N-1A.
Components of equity are the parts of the total Equity balance including that which is allocated to common, preferred, treasury stock, retained earnings, etc.

role.label: Ownership percentage
role.documentation: The percentage of ownership of common stock or equity participation in the investee accounted for under the equity method of accounting.

role.label: Exclusive Private Label Manufacturing Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Exclusive Private Label Manufacturing Agreement [Member]

role.label: Extension
role.documentation: Extension number for local phone number.

role.label: Fair value
role.documentation: The fair value of assets acquired in noncash investing or financing activities.

role.label: Fair Value of Financial Instruments
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for determining the fair value of financial instruments.

role.label: Amortized, Accumulated Amortization
role.documentation: Accumulated amount of amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

role.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets by Major Class [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by major type or class of finite-lived intangible assets.

role.label: Amortized, Gross Amount
role.documentation: Amount before amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

role.label: Finite-Lived Intangible Assets [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

The major class of finite-lived intangible asset (for example, patents, trademarks, copyrights, etc.) A major class is composed of intangible assets that can be grouped together because they are similar, either by their nature or by their use in the operations of a company.

role.label: Amortized, Carrying Value
role.documentation: Amount after amortization of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance with a finite life.

role.label: First PPP Loan [Member]
role.documentation: First PPP Loan [Member]

role.label: Forgone Recovery due to Disqualification of Tax Benefits, Amount
Forgone Recovery due to Expense of Enforcement, Amount
Forgone Recovery due to Violation of Home Country Law, Amount
General and Administrative Expense [Member]
role.documentation: Primary financial statement caption encompassing general and administrative expense.

role.label: Geographic Distribution [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by geographic distribution of business activity identified as either domestic or foreign. Excludes names of countries, states and provinces, and cities.
Allocation of business activity identified as domestic or foreign. Excludes names of countries, states and provinces, and cities.

role.label: Goodwill
role.documentation: Amount, after accumulated impairment loss, of asset representing future economic benefit arising from other asset acquired in business combination or from joint venture formation or both, that is not individually identified and separately recognized.

role.label: CERTAIN ASSETS
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for goodwill and intangible assets.

role.label: Goodwill, Impaired, Accumulated Impairment Loss
role.documentation: Amount of accumulated impairment loss for asset representing future economic benefit arising from other asset acquired in business combination or from joint venture formation or both, that is not individually identified and separately recognized.

role.label: Gross Profit
role.documentation: Aggregate revenue less cost of goods and services sold or operating expenses directly attributable to the revenue generation activity.

role.label: Indefinite-lived, Impairment
role.documentation: Impairment of intangible assets indefinite lived.

role.label: Impairment
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for the impairment and disposal of long-lived assets including goodwill and other intangible assets.

role.label: Income (Loss) from Continuing Operations, Net of Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
role.documentation: Amount after tax of income (loss) from continuing operations including portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest.

role.label: Statement of Income Location, Balance [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by location in statement of income where disaggregated amount is reported.
Location in statement of income where disaggregated amount is reported.

role.label: INCOME TAXES
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for income tax.

role.label: Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
role.documentation: Amount of current income tax expense (benefit) and deferred income tax expense (benefit) pertaining to continuing operations.

role.label: Cash paid for income taxes
role.documentation: Amount, after refund, of cash paid to foreign, federal, state, and local jurisdictions as income tax.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Payable, Trade
role.documentation: Change in recurring obligations of a business that arise from the acquisition of merchandise, materials, supplies and services used in the production and sale of goods and services.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accounts Receivable
role.documentation: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in amount due within one year (or one business cycle) from customers for the credit sale of goods and services.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Accrued Liabilities and Other Operating Liabilities
role.documentation: Amount of increase (decrease) in accrued expenses, and obligations classified as other.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Due from Related Parties, Current
role.documentation: The aggregate increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amount due from the following types of related parties: a parent company and its subsidiaries; subsidiaries of a common parent; an entity and trust for the benefit of employees, such as pension and profit-sharing trusts that are managed by or under the trusteeship of the entity's management; an entity and its principal owners, management, or member of their immediate families, affiliates, or other parties with the ability to exert significant influence.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Interest Payable, Net
role.documentation: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in interest payable, which represents the amount owed to note holders, bond holders, and other parties for interest earned on loans or credit extended to the reporting entity.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Inventories
role.documentation: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate value of all inventory held by the reporting entity, associated with underlying transactions that are classified as operating activities.

role.label: Changes in operating assets and liabilities:
Lease liabilities
role.documentation: Amount of increase (decrease) in obligation for operating lease.

role.negatedLabel: Prepaid expenses and other current assets
role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Prepaid Expense
role.documentation: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amount of outstanding money paid in advance for goods or services that bring economic benefits for future periods.

role.label: Increase (Decrease) in Security Deposits
role.documentation: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in security deposits.

role.label: Indefinite-lived, Accumulated Amortization
role.documentation: Indefinite lived intangible assets accumulated amortization.

role.label: Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type or class of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

role.label: Indefinite-lived, Gross Amount
role.documentation: Amount of assets, excluding financial assets and goodwill, lacking physical substance and having a projected indefinite period of benefit.

The major class of indefinite-lived intangible asset (for example, trade names, etc. but not all-inclusive), excluding goodwill. A major class is composed of intangible assets that can be grouped together because they are similar, either by their nature or by their use in the operations of the company.

role.label: Insider Trading Policies and Procedures [Line Items]
Insider Trading Policies and Procedures Adopted
Insider Trading Policies and Procedures Not Adopted
Intangible assets, net
role.documentation: Sum of the carrying amounts of all intangible assets, excluding goodwill, as of the balance sheet date, net of accumulated amortization and impairment charges.

role.label: Interest expense
role.documentation: Amount of the cost of borrowed funds accounted for as interest expense for debt.

role.label: Interest Expense, Nonoperating
role.documentation: Amount of interest expense classified as nonoperating.

role.label: Cash paid for interest
role.documentation: Amount of cash paid for interest, excluding capitalized interest, classified as operating activity. Includes, but is not limited to, payment to settle zero-coupon bond for accreted interest of debt discount and debt instrument with insignificant coupon interest rate in relation to effective interest rate of borrowing attributable to accreted interest of debt discount.

role.label: Accrued interest payable
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of [accrued] interest payable on all forms of debt, including trade payables, that has been incurred and is unpaid. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).

role.label: Finished goods
role.documentation: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of completed merchandise or goods expected to be sold within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Inventory
role.documentation: Amount after valuation and LIFO reserves of inventory expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Inventory, Policy [Policy Text Block]
role.documentation: Disclosure of inventory accounting policy for inventory classes, including, but not limited to, basis for determining inventory amounts, methods by which amounts are added and removed from inventory classes, loss recognition on impairment of inventories, and situations in which inventories are stated above cost.

role.label: Raw materials
role.documentation: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of raw materials expected to be sold, or consumed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Work in process
role.documentation: Amount before valuation and LIFO reserves of merchandise or goods in the production process expected to be completed within one year or operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Issuance of Stock and Warrants for Services or Claims
role.documentation: Fair value of share-based compensation granted to nonemployees as payment for services rendered or acknowledged claims.

role.label: Lawsuit against Bailey 44 Related to Retail Store Lease [Member]
role.documentation: Lawsuit against Bailey 44 Related to Retail Store Lease [Member]

role.label: Lawsuit Against Company [Member]
role.documentation: Lawsuit Against Company [Member]

role.label: Legal Entity [Axis]
role.documentation: The set of legal entities associated with a report.

role.label: Legal fee
role.documentation: The amount of expense provided in the period for legal costs incurred on or before the balance sheet date pertaining to resolved, pending or threatened litigation, including arbitration and mediation proceedings.

role.label: Leases
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for leasing arrangement entered into by lessee.

role.label: Short term leases
role.documentation: Term of lessee's operating lease, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days.

role.label: LEASE OBLIGATIONS
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for operating leases of lessee. Includes, but is not limited to, description of operating lease and maturity analysis of operating lease liability.

role.label: Liabilities
role.documentation: Amount of liability recognized for present obligation requiring transfer or otherwise providing economic benefit to others.

role.label: Liabilities and Equity
role.documentation: Amount of liabilities and equity items, including the portion of equity attributable to noncontrolling interests, if any.

role.label: Non-cash purchase of intangible assets
role.documentation: The fair value of liabilities assumed in noncash investing or financing activities.

role.label: Liabilities, Current
role.documentation: Total obligations incurred as part of normal operations that are expected to be paid during the following twelve months or within one business cycle, if longer.

role.label: Litigation Settlement, Amount Awarded to Other Party
role.documentation: Amount awarded to other party in judgment or settlement of litigation.

role.label: Loan Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Loan Agreement [Member]

role.label: Loan payable, current
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of portion of long-term loans payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

role.label: Local Phone Number
role.documentation: Local phone number for entity.

role.label: London Interbank Offered Rate Libor 2 [Member]
role.documentation: London Interbank Offered Rate Libor 2 [Member]

role.label: Long-Term Debt
role.documentation: Amount, after deduction of unamortized premium (discount) and debt issuance cost, of long-term debt. Excludes lease obligation.

role.label: Loan payable
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of loans payable (with maturities initially due after one year or beyond the operating cycle if longer), excluding current portion.

role.label: Long Term Marketing Service Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Long Term Marketing Service Agreement [Member]

role.label: Loss Contingency Nature [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type of existing condition, situation, or set of circumstances involving uncertainty as to possible loss to an enterprise that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events occur or fail to occur.

role.label: Loss Contingencies [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

role.label: Loss Contingencies [Table]
role.documentation: Disclosure of information about loss contingency. Excludes environmental contingency, warranty, and unconditional purchase obligation.

role.label: Accrued litigation settlement
role.documentation: Amount of loss contingency liability expected to be resolved within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Claims settled after signing long-term lease
role.documentation: Amount of damages paid to the plaintiff in the legal matter.

role.label: Trade payables
role.documentation: The value (monetary amount) of the award the plaintiff seeks in the legal matter.

An existing condition, situation, or set of circumstances involving uncertainty as to possible loss to an enterprise that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events occur or fail to occur. Resolution of the uncertainty may confirm the incurrence of a loss or impairment of an asset or the incurrence of a liability.

role.label: Marketing Services Agreement [Member]
role.documentation: Marketing Services Agreement [Member]

role.label: Services Period
role.documentation: Marketing services period

role.label: Matured funds and deposits
role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of matured funds and deposits with related parties, classified as current.

role.label: Maximum commission and fees payable
role.documentation: Maximum commission and fees payable.

role.label: Merchant Advances [Member]
role.documentation: Merchant Advances [Member]

role.label: MNPI Disclosure Timed for Compensation Value
Monthly Installments [Member]
role.documentation: Monthly Installments [Member]

role.label: Mosbest, LLC [Member]
role.documentation: Mosbest, LLC [Member]

role.label: NATURE OF OPERATIONS
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for the nature of an entity's business, major products or services, principal markets including location, and the relative importance of its operations in each business and the basis for the determination, including but not limited to, assets, revenues, or earnings. For an entity that has not commenced principal operations, disclosures about the risks and uncertainties related to the activities in which the entity is currently engaged and an understanding of what those activities are being directed toward.

role.totalLabel: Net cash provided by financing activities
role.label: Cash Provided by (Used in) Financing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation
role.documentation: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from financing activity, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation. Financing activity includes, but is not limited to, obtaining resource from owner and providing return on, and return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amount borrowed, or settling obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resource obtained from creditor on long-term credit.

role.label: Cash flows provided by financing activities:

role.totalLabel: Net cash used in investing activities
role.label: Cash Provided by (Used in) Investing Activity, Including Discontinued Operation
role.documentation: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from investing activity, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation. Investing activity includes, but is not limited to, making and collecting loan, acquiring and disposing of debt and equity instruments, property, plant, and equipment, and other productive assets.

role.label: Cash flows used in investing activities:

role.totalLabel: Net cash used in operating activities
role.label: Cash Provided by (Used in) Operating Activity, Including Discontinued Operation
role.documentation: Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from operating activity, including, but not limited to, discontinued operation. Operating activity includes, but is not limited to, transaction, adjustment, and change in value not defined as investing or financing activity.

role.label: Cash flows used in operating activities:
Net loss
role.documentation: The portion of profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, which is attributable to the parent.

role.label: No Trading Symbol Flag
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true only for a security having no trading symbol.

role.label: Non-cash issuance of shares
role.documentation: Non cash issuance of shares

role.label: Non-PEO NEO Average Compensation Actually Paid Amount
Non-PEO NEO Average Total Compensation Amount
Supplemental disclosure of non-cash investing and financing activities:
Non-cash prepaid marketing expense
role.documentation: Noncash prepaid marketing expense.

role.label: Nonoperating Income (Expense)
role.documentation: The aggregate amount of income or expense from ancillary business-related activities (that is to say, excluding major activities considered part of the normal operations of the business).

role.label: Notes Payable
role.documentation: Including the current and noncurrent portions, aggregate carrying amount of all types of notes payable, as of the balance sheet date, with initial maturities beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Promissory note payable, net
role.documentation: Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of the portions of long-term notes payable due within one year or the operating cycle if longer.

role.label: Number of operating segment
role.documentation: Number of operating segments. An operating segment is a component of an enterprise: (a) that engages in business activities from which it may earn revenues and incur expenses (including revenues and expenses relating to transactions with other components of the same enterprise), (b) whose operating results are regularly reviewed by the enterprise's chief operating decision maker to make decisions about resources to be allocated to the segment and assess its performance, and (c) for which discrete financial information is available. An operating segment may engage in business activities for which it has yet to earn revenues, for example, start-up operations may be operating segments before earning revenues.

role.label: Number of reportable segment
role.documentation: Number of segments reported by the entity. A reportable segment is a component of an entity for which there is an accounting requirement to report separate financial information on that component in the entity's financial statements.

role.label: Operating Expenses
role.documentation: Generally recurring costs associated with normal operations except for the portion of these expenses which can be clearly related to production and included in cost of sales or services. Includes selling, general and administrative expense.

role.label: Operating Income (Loss)
role.documentation: The net result for the period of deducting operating expenses from operating revenues.

role.label: Organization, Consolidation and Presentation of Financial Statements [Abstract]
Due from factor, net
role.documentation: Amount of current assets classified as other.

role.label: DUE FROM FACTOR
role.documentation: The entire disclosure for other assets. This disclosure includes other current assets and other noncurrent assets.

role.label: Other expenses
role.documentation: Amount of expense classified as other.

role.label: Other liabilities
role.documentation: Amount of liabilities classified as other.

role.label: Due to related parties
role.documentation: Amount of liabilities classified as other, due within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Investments
role.documentation: Amount of long-term investments classified as other.

role.label: Non-cash lease expense
role.documentation: Amount of expense or loss included in net income that result in no cash flow, classified as other.

role.label: Other non-operating (expenses) income
role.documentation: Amount of income (expense) related to nonoperating activities, classified as other.

role.label: Other Receivables, Net, Current
role.documentation: Amount, after allowance, of receivables classified as other, due within one year or the operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Other Reporting Standard Item Number
role.documentation: "Item 17" or "Item 18" specified when the basis of accounting is neither US GAAP nor IFRS.

role.label: Outstanding receivables:
role.documentation: Outstanding receivables abstract.

role.label: With recourse
role.documentation: The amount of outstanding receivables with recourse of factor.

role.label: Without recourse
role.documentation: The amount of outstanding receivables without recourse of factor.

role.label: PPP Loan [Member]
role.documentation: PPP Loan [Member]

role.label: Settlement amount
role.documentation: The amount of cash paid for the settlement of litigation or for other legal issues during the period.

role.label: Cash purchase price
role.documentation: The net cash inflow or outflow associated with the aggregate amount of adjustment to the purchase price of a previous acquisition.

role.label: Payments for Rent
role.documentation: Cash payments to lessor's for use of assets under operating leases.

role.label: Peer Group Total Shareholder Return Amount
Placement Agent Warrants [Member]
role.documentation: Placement Agent Warrants [Member]

role.label: Pre-commencement Issuer Tender Offer
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the Form 8-K filing is intended to satisfy the filing obligation of the registrant as pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 13e-4(c) under the Exchange Act.

role.label: Pre-commencement Tender Offer
role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the Form 8-K filing is intended to satisfy the filing obligation of the registrant as pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule 14d-2(b) under the Exchange Act.

role.label: Pre-funded Warrants [Member]
role.documentation: Pre-funded Warrants [Member]

role.label: Conversion price (in dollars per share)
role.documentation: Per share conversion price of preferred stock.

role.label: Preferred Stock [Member]
role.documentation: Preferred shares may provide a preferential dividend to the dividend on common stock and may take precedence over common stock in the event of a liquidation. Preferred shares typically represent an ownership interest in the company.

role.label: Preferred stock, par value
role.verboseLabel: Preferred stock, par value (in dollars per share)
role.documentation: Face amount or stated value per share of preferred stock nonredeemable or redeemable solely at the option of the issuer.

role.label: Preferred stock, shares authorized
role.documentation: The maximum number of nonredeemable preferred shares (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) permitted to be issued by an entity's charter and bylaws.

role.label: Preferred stock, shares issued
role.documentation: Number of shares issued for nonredeemable preferred shares and preferred shares redeemable solely at option of issuer. Includes, but is not limited to, preferred shares issued, repurchased, and held as treasury shares. Excludes preferred shares classified as debt.

role.label: Preferred stock, shares outstanding
role.documentation: Aggregate share number for all nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer) held by stockholders. Does not include preferred shares that have been repurchased.

role.label: Preferred stock, value
role.documentation: Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable preferred stock (or preferred stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for number of nonredeemable preferred shares, par value and other disclosure concepts are in another section within stockholders' equity.

role.verboseLabel: Prepaid expenses and other current assets
role.label: Prepaid Expense and Other Assets, Current
role.documentation: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits in future periods, and amount of other assets that are expected to be realized or consumed within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Prepaid expenses and other current assets
role.documentation: Amount of asset related to consideration paid in advance for costs that provide economic benefits within a future period of one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Prepaid amount
role.documentation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of expenditures made in advance of when the economic benefit of the cost will be realized, and which will be expensed in future periods with the passage of time or when a triggering event occurs.

role.label: Prepaid marketing expenses
role.documentation: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of amounts paid in advance for expenses which will be charged against earnings in periods after one year or beyond the operating cycle, if longer.

role.label: Prime Rate [Member]
role.documentation: Interest rate charged by financial institutions to their most creditworthy borrowers.

role.label: Net proceeds
role.documentation: The cash inflow from additional borrowings, net of cash paid to third parties in connection with debt origination.

role.label: Proceeds from offerings
role.documentation: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from entity's first offering of stock to the public.

role.label: Issuance of common stock in cash
role.documentation: The cash inflow from the additional capital contribution to the entity.

role.label: Proceeds for issuance of pre-funded warrants
role.documentation: Proceeds from issuance of common stock and pre-funded warrants pursuant to private placement offering.

role.label: Proceeds from convertible preferred stock
role.verboseLabel: Proceeds from Issuance of Convertible Preferred Stock
role.documentation: The cash inflow from issuance of preferred stocks identified as being convertible into another form of financial instrument, typically the entity's common stock.

role.label: Issuance of loans and note payable
role.documentation: Proceeds from issuance of loans and notes payable.

role.label: Gross proceeds
role.documentation: The cash inflow from the issuance of common stock, preferred stock, treasury stock, stock options, and other types of equity.

role.label: Proceeds from Related Party Debt
role.documentation: The cash inflow from a long-term borrowing made from related parties where one party can exercise control or significant influence over another party; including affiliates, owners or officers and their immediate families, pension trusts, and so forth. Alternate caption: Proceeds from Advances from Affiliates.

role.label: Proceeds from warrant exercise
role.documentation: The cash inflow associated with the amount received from holders exercising their stock warrants.

role.label: Professional Fees
role.documentation: A fee charged for services from professionals such as doctors, lawyers and accountants. The term is often expanded to include other professions, for example, pharmacists charging to maintain a medicinal profile of a client or customer.

role.label: Net Income (Loss), Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest
role.documentation: The consolidated profit or loss for the period, net of income taxes, including the portion attributable to the noncontrolling interest.

role.label: Promissory Note Payable [Member]
role.documentation: Promissory Note Payable [Member]

role.label: Long-Lived Tangible Asset [Axis]
role.documentation: Information by type of long-lived, physical assets used to produce goods and services and not intended for resale.

role.label: Property, Plant and Equipment [Line Items]
role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.

role.label: Property, Plant and Equipment [Member]
role.documentation: Physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

role.label: Property, equipment and software, net
role.documentation: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.

role.label: Property, Equipment, and Software
role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for long-lived, physical asset used in normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Includes, but is not limited to, work of art, historical treasure, and similar asset classified as collections.

Listing of long-lived, physical assets that are used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include land, buildings, machinery and equipment, and other types of furniture and equipment including, but not limited to, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment and software.

role.label: Property, Plant and Equipment, Useful Life
role.documentation: Useful life of long lived, physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents the reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days. Examples include, but not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, furniture and fixtures, and computer equipment.

role.label: Redemption percentage

role.label: SCHEDULE OF INFORMATION RELATED TO COMMON STOCK WARRANTS
role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of warrants or rights issued. Warrants and rights outstanding are derivative securities that give the holder the right to purchase securities (usually equity) from the issuer at a specific price within a certain time frame. Warrants are often included in a new debt issue to entice investors by a higher return potential. The main difference between warrants and call options is that warrants are issued and guaranteed by the company, whereas options are exchange instruments and are not issued by the company. Also, the lifetime of a warrant is often measured in years, while the lifetime of a typical option is measured in months. Disclose the title of issue of securities called for by warrants and rights outstanding, the aggregate amount of securities called for by warrants and rights outstanding, the date from which the warrants or rights are exercisable, and the price at which the warrant or right is exercisable.

General and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel, rent, utilities, communication, etc.
